snippet: Mr. Zhou, the highest-ranking official felled in China’s anticorruption campaign, was tried in secret in the city of Tianjin, the state news media reported.
abstract: China's former security chief Zhou Yongkang is sentenced to life in prison for corruption and other bribery-related charges; is most senior official ever jailed for corruption in China.

byline.contributor: Austin Ramzy contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Research was contributed by Vanessa Piao, Kiki Zhao, Mia Li and Yufan Huang from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Zhou, the highest-ranking official felled in China’s anticorruption campaign, was tried in secret in the city of Tianjin, the state news media reported.

headline.main: Zhou Yongkang, Ex-Security Chief in China, Gets Life Sentence for Graft
headline.print_headline: A Purge Moves China Into Uncharted Territory

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
